== Copy editing == Hi, I noticed the request to copy edit this article. I've just now begun. Please feel free to review my edits as I don't want to change any content. One thing I notice is that I think someone who knows more about the subject could assist me in paring the text a bit. My main concern is article and paragraph length, but I'm hesitant to remove anything that would alter the flow/structure of the article. [[User:Lazulilasher|Lazulilasher]] ([[User talk:Lazulilasher|talk]]) 20:26, 6 August 2008 (UTC) :I'm confused about this sentence, from the first paragraph of the background section: "In the latter two, it was especially pan-Islamic groups Indian groups." [[User:Lazulilasher|Lazulilasher]] ([[User talk:Lazulilasher|talk]]) 20:30, 6 August 2008 (UTC)
::First of all, thanks for your help. With re to your question, that' supposed to mean "the latter two countries", ie Turkey and Persia. I know the article length is quite long, but I felt the background (where I wanted to cut down, and have) would be context less, especially because of wikipedia as well as internet coveage is very vague on the stuff that is covered, but these are very important to the background. The journal I used in fact had five pages on the background context alone. [[::User: rueben_lys| rueben_lys]] ([[::User talk: rueben_lys|talk]] '''·''' [[::Special:Contributions/ rueben_lys|contribs]]) 01:09, 7 August 2008 (UTC) :::No problem. Sorry it's taking me so long. I'm going to continue through the article, but I'm trying to be careful to not disrupt the thematic elements. Actually, as I was reading more of the article, I've come to find the background info more useful--especially for a neophyte like me. I think what we should do is work through it, discuss, and then see if there is anyway we can prune without losing cohesiveness. Agreed tho--with a topic such as this, it is important to have background (otherwise it's difficult to understand). All things considered though, this is extremely well-written and informative and I'm learning a lot as I go (slowly, I know :) )[[User:Lazulilasher|Lazulilasher]] ([[User talk:Lazulilasher|talk]]) 03:07, 7 August 2008 (UTC)
:Question: I'm unsure, should it be middle-east or middle east, and should it be capitalised? There are different uses throughout the article and I'm unsure of the term's correct manner. [[User:Lazulilasher|Lazulilasher]] ([[User talk:Lazulilasher|talk]]) 02:58, 8 August 2008 (UTC)
The Second Expedition. It appears to me that references to Kermanshah should read "Kerman". Kermanshah is in the west of Persia which is a long way from where the expedition was operating.
Bill Hall
[[Special:Contributions/81.132.149.193|81.132.149.193]] ([[User talk:81.132.149.193|talk]]) 16:08, 10 May 2010 (UTC) ==File:Kaiser's invitation to Mahendra Pratap.jpg Nominated for speedy Deletion== <!--TSTAMP:{{{4}}}--> {| |- | [[File:Image-x-generic.svg|100px]] | <!--IMAGES--> An image used in this article, [[:File:Kaiser's invitation to Mahendra Pratap.jpg|File:Kaiser's invitation to Mahendra Pratap.jpg]], has been nominated for speedy deletion for the following reason: ''Wikipedia files with no non-free use rationale as of 3 December 2011'' <!--/IMAGES--> ;What should I do? ''Don't panic''; you should have time to contest the deletion (although please review [[WP:CSD|deletion guidelines]] before doing so). The best way to contest this form of deletion is by posting on the image talk page. * If the image is [[WP:NFCC|non-free]] then you may need to provide a [[WP:FUR|fair use rationale]] * If the image isn't freely licensed and there is no fair use rationale, then it cannot be uploaded or used. * If the image has already been deleted you may want to try [[WP:DRV|Deletion Review]]
''This notification is provided by a Bot'' --[[User:CommonsNotificationBot|CommonsNotificationBot]] ([[User talk:CommonsNotificationBot|talk]]) 08:15, 3 December 2011 (UTC) |}
